title: Need to use Malaysia's strong tourism fundamentals to woo tourists, says PM NajibTravelandtourworld.com
text:
Need to use Malaysia’s strong tourism fundamentals to woo tourists, says PM Najib Published on : Friday, August 28, 2015
Malaysia’s tourism fundamentals are still strong and need be conveyed through various channels to woo in more visitors to the country, said Malaysia Prime Minister Najib Tun Razak.
At an event titled ‘An Hour with the Prime Minister’ organised by the Malaysian Association of Tour and Travel Agents (MATTA) in Kuala Lumpur Thursday, Najib listed them down as the country’s renowned hospitality and a culture of friendliness, rich natural heritage, cultural diversity and now, more than ever, the value for money that foreign tourists would experience in Malaysia compared to other destinations due to the exchange rates.
The Prime Minister, however, further stated the government was aware of the stiff competition with other countries equally driven to pull in tourists into their borders.
To gain an edge over others ‘”Incentives may need to be revised and immigration issues like visa-on-arrival and visa fees as well as electronic visas need to be revisited to make it easier for tourists to enter the country’, said Najib.
Najib pointed out that MATTA and its members had a role to play to help project the truth about the country to markets abroad.
This should be done, he said, “so that misconceptions and negative views grounded in falsehood – especially as spread through social media – can be corrected and tourists are not put off from visiting the country”.
Najib said airlines and airports too needed to be further engaged to increase direct flights and greater connectivity, both of which had shown to be directly correlated to increased tourist arrivals.
